q_option: Will grow eight times of its initial rate
Rate reduce to one eights of its initial rate

q_option: It represents the dependence of reaction rate on concentration of reacting species
It is determined empirically and is not necessarily related to the stoichiometry of reaction

1.q_string: The temperature coefficient of a reaction is:

The rate constant, the activation energy and the Arrhenius parameter (A) of a chemical reaction at \(25^{\circ} C\) are \(3.0 \times 10^{-22} s ^{-1}, 104.4 kJ mol ^{-1} 6.0 \times 10^{14} s ^{-1}\) and respectively. The value of the rate constant at \(T \rightarrow \infty\) is:

q_option: increases the equilibrium concentrations of the products
increases the frequency of collision of reacting species
1.q_string: A catalyst is a substance which:

\(SO _{2} Cl _{2} \rightarrow SO _{2}+ Cl _{2}\) is a first order gas reaction with \(k =2.2 \times 10^{-5} sec ^{-1}\) at \(320^{\circ} C\). The percentage of \(SO _{2} Cl _{2}\) decomposed on heating for 90 minutes is:

q_option: The difference in energies of reactants and products
The sum of energies of reactants and products
The difference in energies of intermediate complexes with the average energy of reactants and products
The difference in energies of intermediate complexes and the average energy of reactants
